page.title: 12MAURICE LEA MEMORIAL PARK
page.content: {Mr. Herbert Lea}financed & opened the park in{l929}in memory of his son {Lieutenant Maurice Bertram Lea}killed in World War 1.The park is both well used and well maintained & is valued as a safe place for children to play. It has facilities for bowling (flat & crown),putting,tennis and there is a children's play area offering swings,a slide,spring bikes & a sandpit.There is a fish pond and a bandstand (used occasionally).It has a playing field,formal flower beds & lawns surrounded by a beautiful variety of shrubs and trees.The park is used for annual events such as The Gresley Carnival,Sport For All & other local fetes.There are numerous benches on which to sit & enjoy watching the gardeners at work & to admire the seasonal changes or to relax in the tranquil atmosphere.
